contents.narration:
Giraffes are native to Africa and are known for being the tallest mammals on Earth. They can grow up to 18 feet tall. That is as tall as a two story house! <break time="0.5s" /> 
  
    Giraffes are very strange animals because they spend most of their lives standing up. They eat standing up. They give birth standing up. They even sleep standing up! These creatures are vegetarians. That means they do not eat meat. Giraffes usually like to pick their food from the top of trees and bushes using their long necks. <break time="0.5s" />
  
    Giraffes are covered in spots. No two of these spot patterns are alike. It is like how every human has a unique fingerprint. End of description. <break time="1s" />

The Giant Panda bear is an animal native to China and they have lived in China for thousands of years. They are the only bear species known to survive only on a vegetarian diet. They love to eat bamboo. It is their favorite food. They love it so much that they can eat 40 pounds of bamboo a day. I wish I could eat 40 pounds of tacos! <break time="0.5s" />
    
    Adult pandas weigh between 200 and 300 pounds. Mothers are 900 times bigger than their cubs when the cubs are born. Because cubs are so tiny, they can be tricky to keep track of sometimes. <break time="0.5s" />
    
    Many panda habitats, <break time="0.2s" /> where the animals live, have been destroyed by human activity. This has resulted in a drop of the number of pandas still living on Earth. <break time="0.5s"/>
    End of description.

Koi Fish are descendants of Carp Fish that were raised in Chinese rice fields during the Jin Dynasty, 1700 years ago. In the early 19th century, these Carp fish began being bred for variations in color. They eventually became what we know today as the Koi fish. Koi Fish have beautiful colors and can have colorful spots and patterns. These pretty fish can have white, black, red, cream, yellow, blue, and orange. <break time="0.5s"/>
    
    Some Koi fish can grow up to be 3 feet long. They are omnivores. That means that they will eat meat and eat plants. They will eat insects, other fish, peas, lettuce, and even watermelon. A lot of owners will feed Koi Fish food that floats so that the fish will come to the surface and show off their pretty color patterns. Because Koi Fish are smart. they also learn to recognize their owners when they come up and look above the water during feeding time. <break time="0.5s"/>
    
    Koi Fish typically live an average of 50 years. However, some Koi Fish have lived over 200 years! A Koi Fish in Japan, named Hanako, lived to be 226 years old. That's definitely older than Grandma. <break time="0.5s"/>
    
    End of Description. <break time="0.5s"/>

Lions are native to sub-Saharan Africa and stand tall as the second largest cat in the entire world. They are very social animals that live together in packs called prides. Male lions can be as long as 7 feet and, on average, weigh 400 pounds. <break time="0.5s"/>
    
    The male lion flaunts a beautiful mane and is generally what most people think about when they think about the fear-giving power of a lion. But it is actually the mane-less female lions that do most of the hunting in a pride. The females use well thought-out tactics to capture the necessary 11 pounds of meat that they each need a day, and the 15 pounds of meat each male lion needs per day. <break time="0.5s"/>
    
    Lions are blazing fast. In small lengths, they can reach up to 50 miles per hour. I wish I could run that fast. If that isn't scary enough, their powerful roars can be heard from 5 miles away. 
    
    <break time="0.5s"/>Despite their menacing stature, lions spend most of their day sleeping. They generally sleep and laze around for 16 to 20 hours. Sounds like me on a weekend. <break time="0.5s"/>
    
    End of Description. <break time="0.5s"/>
I'm sorry. I was not able to find {info_animal} in the animal log book.

Here is a list of all the treasures you have picked up on your adventures.  
     
    <break time="0.2s"/>

You have a dragon statue! It looks like it's made of clay. I wonder how old it is.  
     
    <break time="0.2s" />

You have an old chinese yoyo. I bet some people did some sick tricks with this thing back in the day.  
     
    <break time="0.2s" />

That is all the treasures you have collected so far. 
     
    <break time="0.2s" />
You currently have not found any treasures. You can find treasures by searching and exploring different places during your adventures.
Here is a list of all the badges you currently have recieved.

The Puzzle Solver badge. This badge is awarded for solving tough puzzles during an adventure. This badge is currently at level 1. 
     
    <break time="0.2s" />

The Curiosity badge. Only the most curious of Rangers can earn this badge. You are definitely a true explorer at heart. This badge is currently at level 1. 
     
    <break time="0.2s" />

The Crazy Climber badge. You have to have climbed somewhere very high to get a badge like this. I'm impressed. This badge is currently at level 1. 
     
    <break time="0.2s" />

That is all of the badges that you have currently received. 
     
    <break time="0.2s" />
You currently have not received any badges. You can earn badges by solving puzzles and accomplishing tasks during your adventures.

<audio src='https://christianheckerlambda.s3.amazonaws.com/rescue_rangers/rescue-rangers/en-US/audio/alice_open.mp3'/>
    
    Hi there! Good to see a fresh new face around here. I am Alice.
    You may have heard of my twin sister Alexa. She is very famous now.
    <break time="0.5s" />
    
    I work as a virtual assistant for the Animal Rescue Rangers. The Animal Rescue Rangers are a group of people determined to help animals all over the world. Whenever there is an animal in need, the Rescue Rangers will be there to save the day.
    <break time="0.3s" />
    
    In this game, you are a ranger who is training to become part of the Animal Rescue Rangers. You have been paired up with a top-notch Rescue Ranger named Olive. She is going to tell you everything you need to know. I will also be with you at all times. So if you need help at any time, you can say help.
    <break time="0.5s" />

parameters.target: Episode1-Prompt Player to Play the Game

contents.narration: If you are ready for adventure, you can say play the game. Otherwise you can say quit.

parameters.message: You can say play the game or you can say quit.
You can say play the game or you can say quit.

scenes.id: Episode1-Prompt Player to Play the Game

Episode 1.
    <break time="0.4s" />
    A New Adventure Awaits.

    <break time="0.7s" />

Alright Ranger. I will now be teleporting you to the Animal Rescue Rangers headquarters. Hold on tight and good luck with your training. You are going to do great.
    <break time="0.5s" />
<audio src='https://christianheckerlambda.s3.amazonaws.com/rescue_rangers/rescue-rangers/en-US/audio/olive_intro.mp3'/>

    <audio src='https://christianheckerlambda.s3.amazonaws.com/rescue_rangers/rescue-rangers/en-US/audio/climb_speech3_without_wwyltd.mp3'/>

<audio src='https://christianheckerlambda.s3.amazonaws.com/rescue_rangers/rescue-rangers/en-US/audio/climb_speech1_without_wwyltd.mp3'/>

    <audio src='https://christianheckerlambda.s3.amazonaws.com/rescue_rangers/rescue-rangers/en-US/audio/skydive_speech2.mp3'/>

parameters.message: We have jumped off the lion wall and are falling fast. Say, activate ranger pack, or, activate parachute to slow your fall.
We have jumped off the lion wall and are falling fast. Say, activate ranger pack, or, activate parachute to slow your fall.

parameters.target: Episode1-Return Panda and Return to HQ

contents.narration:
<audio src='https://christianheckerlambda.s3.amazonaws.com/rescue_rangers/rescue-rangers/en-US/audio/final_speech.mp3'/>
    <audio src='https://christianheckerlambda.s3.amazonaws.com/rescue_rangers/rescue-rangers/en-US/audio/teleportation_sound.mp3'/>

scenes.id: Episode1-Return Panda and Return to HQ

contents.narration:
That's the end of episode 1.
    
    Ranger I am truly impressed. You went to China. Searched the zoo. Crawled through air vents. Battled lions. Climbed walls. Skydived. And you rescued a baby panda and got him back to his mother safely. <break time="0.5s" />
    
    The Rescue Rangers owe you a big thanks. I think you have a great future here. 
    
    <break time="0.2s" />
    There are more episodes coming soon, so don't forget to check back in.
    
    You're officially a Rescue Ranger. <break time="0.2s" /> Until next time. 
    
    <break time="0.5s" />
    
    Over and out.
    
    <break time="2s" />
Playing episode 2.

Good morning Ranger. Good to see you again.  
     
    I took the liberty of turning on your alarm for you last night. You have another day of 
    training ahead of you today. You don't want to be late. 
     

     
    Why don't we start getting ready? 
     
    What color jacket would you like to wear? Pink, Yellow, or Blue?
Nothing wrong with a little pink. You are looking stylish.
Shine like yellow. Looking good.
Everyone knows blue is the new black. Nice choice.

Now let's eat some breakfast! 
     
    Would you like cereal, a muffin, or eggs?
Nothing like some Chocolatey Marshmallow Puffs for breakfast. Yummy!
That blueberry muffin sure looks tasty. Good choice Ranger.
Those eggs will give you some good protein for your adventures today.

Ranger. It appears you have a voicemail from Ranger Olive. Please say 
    confirm to listen to the voicemail.

Hi Ranger! It's Olive! Hope you're rested up and ready for another day of training! 
    I will be waiting for you at the Rescue Ranger headquarters. Whenever you are ready 
    to start, just have Alice teleport you to HQ. See you soon! 
     
    Alright Ranger. What would you like to do?

Initiating teleportation. 

    Welcome to Rescue rangers HQ.  

     
    Let's go inside and see if we can find Olive. 


     

    HQ sure is lively today. 

     

    Ranger!  

    Looks like Alice got you here safe and sound. Glad you could make it! I'm excited 
    for us to get started on some more training! You're getting closer and closer 
    to getting to go off on your own and make the world a better place as an 
    Animal Rescue Ranger. 

    Rescuing that panda was an awesome training experience for you, but today I thought 
    we could take things a little more slow and talk about another part of the job that 
    is just as important as rescuing animals in need. And that is, caring for injured 
    animals and helping them get back on their feet. 
     

    We will be heading down to the Amazon Rain Forest, down in Brazil. There are many 
    beautiful animals in the Amazon, many of which need our help. We have a facility called 
    The Treehouse in the Amazon Rain Forest that specializes in helping injured and sick 
    animals. 
     

    Well, sorry for the short visit to HQ. Maybe I'll give you a better tour of the 
    place next time. 

    I'm going to head over to Brazil now. Whenever you're ready, just ask Alice to teleport 
    you to Brazil. I'll meet you over there. 
     
    Alice, teleport me to Brazil. 
     
    Initiating Teleportation. 

     

    What would you like to do ranger?

Initiating teleportation. 

     
    Welcome to Brazil. 

     

    Ranger! Welcome to Brazil! It is so gorgeous here! We are right in the heart of 
    the Amazon Rain Forest! 

     

    Look! Over there! That's the Treehouse! 
    Let's get over there so I can show you around! 
     

    Did you know that there are over 10 million species of animals, plants, and 
    insects known to man? Over half of them lives in this rain forest. That's crazy! 

     
    Welp, here we are! 

    You didn't think it was an actual treehouse did you. This is our state of the art 
    research and rehabilitation center. Researchers and doctors come from all over the 
    world to study and help animals here. 
     
    C'mon! Let's go inside and I will introduce you to the lead researcher, Paolo. 

     

    Paolo! So nice to see you again! 
     

    Oh Ranger Olive! It is great to see you as well! And who do we have here? 
     

    Oh how rude of me! This is our new ranger. We are still training and going through the ropes. 
    We thought you could show us around the Treehouse. 
     

    Oh nice to meet you ranger! I would love to show you guys around!  
    Dr. Da Silva, please cover for me while I show these Rangers around. 
     

     
    Come on Rangers. Let's go through here first. 
     

     
    This here is the laboratory.  
     

     

    Wow! So many different animals! Are any of them sick? 
     

    Thankfully no. These are animals that have been sick here before. We have been keeping 
    an eye on them. We are doing follow up tests to make sure that they are living 
    normal, healthy lives. We want to learn from them so we can help animals even faster 
    and better than we already do. 
     

    That's so great. 

     

    Next through here we have the hospital wing. Here is where we hold our sick 
    and hurt animals. 
     

    Oh no! Poor babies! 
     
    Will they be alright? 
     

    Oh yes! No worries. We will be able to help each and every one of them to get better. 
    We have a large group of medical professionals working to get them patched up. 
     


     

    That's great! I hope they feel better soon. 
     

    Me too! 
     

    Then right through here is the last room I would like to show you. This is a monitoring 
    slash control room. The control room allows us to controls camera and special robots 
    that we have placed throughout the Amazon rainforest. These cameras and robots help us quickly 
    find any animals that may be hurt or in danger. 
     

    That's incredible! We can see everything in the rainforest from right here! 
     

    That's right. We have been able to help so many animals because of this monitoring 
    system. It's fantastic. 
     


    Doctor Rivera. You're needed in the upper deck board room. Pleae report as soon 
    as possible. 
     

    Oh looks like I'm needed. I will have to cut the tour a little short, but please. 
    You rangers feel right at home and feel free to look around. You should explore 
    The Treehouse while you're here. 
     

    Will do! Thanks Paolo! 
     

    Anytime.

parameters.target: Episode2-Prompt User To Explore After Tour

contents.narration:
Well you heard him Ranger. I think it is a good idea for us to explore this place a little 
    more. I'll let you lead the way. Don't forget about the scan command you learned last time. 
    And Alice and your field guide gadget are always there if you have any questions.  
    What would you like to do ranger?

parameters.target: Episode2-Prompt user to scan/search Control Room

scenes.id: Episode2-Prompt User To Explore After Tour

contents.narration: What would you like to do ranger? You can always say help if you need it.

parameters.target: Episode2-Search control panel after Control Room scan
Episode2-Search closet after Control Room scan
Episode2-Go through Hospital Wing door after Control Room scan

utterances: search the boxes on the shelf

parameters.target: Episode2-Search shelf after Control Room scan

scenes.id: Episode2-Prompt user to scan/search Control Room

contents.narration:
Initializing scan. 

    You are in the control room of a Rescue Rangers facility, The Treehouse. 
    There is a control panel, a closet, a doorway to the hospital wing, and a 
    shelf filled with boxes. Maybe we can go through the doorway to the hospital 
    wing or search either the control panel, the closet, or the shelf.

parameters.target: Episode2-Prompt user to scan/search Control Room

contents.narration:
The control panel contains various complicated looking controls 
    and buttons. It looks like they control the robots and the cameras 
    shown on the screen. Maybe this will come in handy if we need to find something 
    in the rainforest.

parameters.target: Episode2-Prompt user to scan/search Control Room

scenes.id: Episode2-Search control panel after Control Room scan

contents.narration: There's nothing much in this closet. Just a bunch of old brooms and a mop.

parameters.target: Episode2-Prompt user to scan/search Control Room

scenes.id: Episode2-Search closet after Control Room scan

contents.narration:
It is a very dusty shelf. The workers must be too focused on saving animals to dust 
    once in a while. There is something shiny in one of the boxes on the shelf. 

    You found an old key! Better keep it for now. Maybe it will unlock something 
    important later on.

parameters.target: Episode2-Prompt user to scan/search Control Room

scenes.id: Episode2-Search shelf after Control Room scan

contents.narration:
Alright let's go into the hospital wing. 



    Oh these poor animals. I'm glad that Paolo and his team are here to take 
    care of them.

parameters.target: Episode2-Prompt user to scan/search Hospital Wing

scenes.id: Episode2-Go through Hospital Wing door after Control Room scan

contents.narration: What would you like to do ranger?

parameters.target: Episode2-Go through Lab door after Hospital Wing Scan

scenes.id: Episode2-Prompt user to scan/search Hospital Wing

contents.narration:
Initiating scan. 

    You are in the Hospital Wing of the Rescue Rangers facility, The Treehouse. 
    This is for animals who are sick or injured. There is a doorway to the lab, 
    a Squirrel Monkey, a collection of Macaws, a Giant River Otter and a cabinet.

parameters.target: Episode2-Prompt user to scan/search Hospital Wing

contents.narration:
Wow what a cute Squirrel Monkey! This tag here says, Sorriso. That must be his 
    name! Hi Sorriso! They are so little! 

    Wow he sure looks happy to see us! 

    Aww poor baby. It looks like he broke his arm. Maybe he had an accident while trying 
    to climb. I'm glad Paolo and his team managed to bandage Sorriso up. Remember you can 
    always ask your field guide gadget to tell you about any animal you see.

parameters.target: Episode2-Prompt user to scan/search Hospital Wing

contents.narration:
These Macaws are such beautiful birds.  

  The poor things have scratches and bandages 
  all over them. It looks like they were attacked in the jungle. I'm glad they are safe 
  now. 

  Remember you can always ask your field guide gadget about any animal you may see.

parameters.target: Episode2-Prompt user to scan/search Hospital Wing

contents.narration:
Oh what a good little Otter. Hi sweetie. 

    This tag here says Linda. That must be the Otter's name. 
    Hi Linda! 

    She looks a little under the weather. I hope she feels better soon. 

    Remember you can always ask your field guide gadget about any animal you see.

parameters.target: Episode2-Prompt user to scan/search Hospital Wing

contents.narration:
It is a cabinet filled with medical supplies. It has bandages, medicine, and 
    first aid. These supplies used by the staff here to help the animals feel better.

parameters.target: Episode2-Prompt user to scan/search Hospital Wing

contents.narration:
Alright. Let's go into the lab. 


   

   This place is fancy! They must learn a lot about animals here.

scenes.id: Episode2-Go through Lab door after Hospital Wing Scan

contents.narration: What would you like to do ranger?

utterances: Go through door to hospital wing

parameters.target: Episode2-Go through Hospital Wing door after Lab

contents.narration:
Initiating scan. 

    Scan complete. 
    You are in the Laboratory of the Rescue Rangers facility, the Treehouse. There 
    are more Macaws, another Squirrel Monkey, a Caiman, a lab table, and a cabinet. There 
    is also a door back to the hospital wing.

Hey! More Macaws! Hi pretty birds! Hmmm. These lab notes say that they are 
    monitoring how different foods are affecting the birds. Apparently, some bords have 
    been falling ill and they are trying to figure out what food is causing it. Hope they 
    find it!

Another squirrel monkey! So cute! 


    He's running on that little treadmill so fast! 
    Hmmm. These lab notes say that they are having the monkey perform cardiovascular 
    exercises in order to monitor their stamina and health levels. Cardiovascular means 
    heart, so that means they are exercising to monitor how strong the monkey's heart is. 
    Look at him go! What a fast little guy!

Oh my! It's a Caiman. It's like a tiny little baby alligator. Those eyes are out 
    of this world. Hmmm. The lab notes say that they are studying how different water 
    temperatures affect how the Caimans grow and eat. Variations in temperatues may 
    have negative impacts on the lifestyles of these tiny crocs. 
    Watch out for this one ranger! He's got some snapper teeth.

Whoa. So many science things here. There's test tubes, beakers, health monitoring 
    equipment. I don't even know where to look. Hmmm. The notes say they are working 
    on developing chemicals that can help trees in the Amazon get nutrients faster. That 
    would be amazing!

I love exploring! That was so fun! This really is an awesome place. Now that we 
      have looked around a bit, we can learn about how to perform some first aid on 
      animals. 
       

      Rangers! I have to run. There was a disturbance in the Amazon and I have to go 
      investigate to see if any animals got hurt. Unfortunately, we are very short staffed 
      today and some new animals that are hurt and sick have just been brought in. 
       
      Would you be able to patch these animals up while I am away? 
       

      Paolo. You can count on us. The Rescue Rangers will always be there when you are in need. 
       

      Oh thank you so much Rescue Rangers. Everything that you need to know about taking care 
      of these hurt animals is in my Journal. Here you are. 


      Item obtained. It's Paolo's Medical Journal. 
       

      If a sick or injured animals comes in, all you have to do is look in my notebook to 
      figure out how to help them. Can you handle that? 
       

      Absolutely, sir. We got this. 
       

      Once again, thank you so much. Now I must run. Good luck! 
       



      Alright Ranger. You heard him.

scenes.id: Episode2-Go through Hospital Wing door after Lab

contents.narration:
We've got some animals that need our help. All 
    you have to do is use Paolo's journal to figure out what we need to do. To open 
    Paolo's journal, say open Paolo's Journal. To go to the next page in the Journal 
    say, next page. To go to the previous page in the Journal, say previous page. To 
    close the journal say, close journal.
Does that make sense ranger?

Alright! Let's get to it! Look. Here comes the first Animal that we need to take care of. 

    It's a Macaw! 
    It looks like it has been scratched and hurt really badly.
Yay! Great job helping the Macaw. Looks like it is feeling better already!

The next animal is a Toucan.  

    Oh no! It's beak is broken. We need something strong to hold it in place.
That toucan is looking so much better. Nice going! Keep it up Ranger!

It's a Howler Monkey! He looks like he is in a lot of pain. 

    We need some sort of medicine to stop the pain. But which one should we give him?

The Howler Monkey calmed down. It's not in pain anymore. Fantiastic job Ranger! 

    This is the last animal, Ranger! Almost there. Oh my!

It's an anteater! He is covered in spots. Poor baby. Maybe we need to give it some 
    medicine.
What would you like to do Ranger?

Oh no! Looks like you did the wrong thing to help the animal. 
    Remember you can use Paolo's notebook if you are unsure about 
    what to do  for an animal. Let's try this again.

If the Animal is sick and has spots, make sure to give it the green medicine. 

    Would you like to keep reading?

If the Animal is scratched, use the bandages to patch it up. 

    Would you like to keep reading?

If the animal is sick and can't move, make sure to give it the red medicine. 

    Would you like to keep reading?

If the animal is in pain, try and give it some blue medicine. 

    Would you like to keep reading?

If the animal has a broken limb or wing, make a cast to keep the injury safe. 

    That is the end of the journal.

You did it Ranger! We helped all of the animals!  

    Paolo is going to be so proud of you. Let me just let him. 

    The Animal Alert! What could be happening? 
     

    You have an incoming call. 
    Say confirm to open the connection.

Connection Opened. 

    Rangers! Are you there? Can you hear me? 
     

    Paolo hi yes we can hear you! Is everything alright? 
     

    Unfortunately no. The disturbance in the forest that I was investigating. 
    It ended up being a massive forest fire. It is blazing through the Amazon 
    rainforest rapidly. It is destroying large parts of the forest, hurting 
    animals and forcing them out of their homes. 
     


    Oh no! Paolo! That's terrible! 
     

    There was a family of Squirrel Monkeys that was trapped. I jumped in to 
    try and rescue them, but a tree trunk fell and then I got trapped as well. 
    The Monkeys and I are trapped and the fire is on its way. You are the only 
    people who can help us. We need you Rangers! 
     

    We will help Paolo! That's what we do best. 
     

    I knew I could count on you, Rangers! You need to find me in the forest 
    first. Once you do, take one of the Treehouse jungle cars to come and get 
    us. Please hurry. The fire is coming! 
     

    On our way Paolo! Hold on! 
     

    Thank you Rangers. Paolo, out. 
     

    Connection Terminated. 
     

    Ranger! Paolo and the family of Squirrel Monkeys are in trouble. We need to 
    hurry and rescue them. They don't have much time. But we have no idea where in 
    the forest they could be. We need to use something in the Treehouse to find them 
    in the forest. But what could we use?
What should we do ranger? You can always say help if you are not sure.

parameters.target: Episode2-Use Control Room to find Paolo

contents.narration:
Initiating scan. 

    Scan complete. 
    You are currently in the Hospital Wing of the Rescue Rangers facility, the Treehouse. 
    All of the animals have quieted down and seem to be feeling much better. 
    There is a doorway to the control room, a doorway to the Lab, and open cabinet.

That's right! The forest is filled with cameras that we can use to find Paolo. 
    We can control the cameras using the control panel in the Treehouse control room. 
    Let's go! 
     

     
    Alright let me see if I can figure out how to work this thing. 
     

    Hmm. 
     
    Alright Ranger. There are tons of cameras throughout the forest. We are looking for 
    a fire. Unfortunately, we can't be sure that any of the cameras will be pointing 
    to the fire, but we still have sound.  

    I am going to cycle through all of the cameras. If we get to one and you hear a blazing 
    fire then we know that's where Paolo will be. Let's do this Ranger. They're counting on 
    us.

scenes.id: Episode2-Use Control Room to find Paolo

contents.narration: Is this the right camera?
What about this camera ranger? Do you hear the fire?
Maybe this is the right camera. What do you think Ranger? Is this the one?
Listen for this camera. Hear any fire?
This could be it. Do you hear any fire Ranger?
Let's try this camera then. Do you hear any blazing fires?
Alright. Switching to the next camera.

Oh no, I don't think that is the right camera! 
    I don't hear any fire. Let's keep looking.

Yes! I think you are right. Let me just move the camera angle a little bit and. 

    There we go! There's Paolo! 
    Perfect! 
    Awesome job Ranger. You found them! 
     
    Alice. Can you please upload this camera's location to the GPS on the jungle 
    car? 
     

    Uploading data. 

    Upload complete.  
     

    Thanks Alice! 
    Let's hurry to that Jungle Car ranger. They don't have much time. 

     
     


    Hang on Ranger. It's gonna be a bumpy ride! 

     

    Rangers. My sensors indicate low hanging branches up ahead. Unfortunately, 
    I can't tell how far they are. So you may have to duck multiple times before 
    the branch arrives. If the branch sensor is active, I recommend ducking. 
     

    Understood. Thank you Alice. Ranger, if you would like to duck all you have 
    to do is say duck. There is a branch coming up. Say duck to avoid hitting 
    the branch!

Woo! Nice duck Ranger! While we are in the jungle car you can duck at anytime. 
     

    Rangers. My sensors indicate that a group of animals is running through the 
    forest up ahead. I recommend turning to avoid hitting the animals. 
     

    Sound good. Thanks for the warning Alice. Let us know if you see anymore 
    animals. 

    You heard her ranger. If Alice warns you that there are animals in our path up ahead I need 
    you to let me know. To dodge the animals, just yell out turn. We are coming up to the animals. 
    Say turn right now to dodge the animals.

That was a close one! Thanks for telling me to turn ranger. 
     

    Alright Ranger. Remember you can say, duck, to avoid branches and tell me to turn 
    by saying, turn.  
     


     
    I love these Jungle Cars Ranger. I haven't driven one of these since my training days. 
    The handling on them is. 
     

    Whoa! What was that? 
     

    Ranger someone is throwing rocks at us! 
     


    Get out of here you spoiled brats! 
     

    Ranger there are guys on motorcycles chasing after us! Who are they? 
     

    Whoa! It doesn't matter who they are right now. I'm gonna lose control of this thing and 
    crash if they keep hitting us with rocks! 
     
    Ranger you have to do something. 
     
    I have an idea. Our Rescue Packs come equipped with water balloon bazookas! You can use the 
    water balloon bazooka to knock those bad guys off of their bikes! 
     
    To get the water bazooka all you have to say is Activate Rescue pack! Come on ranger. 
    Say Activate Rescue Pack!

parameters.target: Episode2-Jungle Car Tutorial Rescue Pack Response

contents.narration:
Initializing rescue pack. 
    Water balloon bazooka is online and ready for you ranger. 

     
    To use the water baloon bazooka just say fire. 
     

    Great! Those bad guys are still on my tail so let's give that 
    bazooka a whirl Ranger. Aim and say fire!

parameters.target: Episode2-Jungle Car Tutorial Water Bazooka Fired Response

scenes.id: Episode2-Jungle Car Tutorial Rescue Pack Response

contents.narration:
Oh man! You got him! Nice shot ranger! 
    
    Alright. I need you to cover me while I drive. If we get hit with too many rocks I will 
    lose control of the car. So take care of those jerks for me. Remember. Duck. Turn. Fire. 
    
    Let's do this!

parameters.target: Episode2-Jungle Car Chase set up Variables
Episode2-Jungle Car Chase Random Alarm Generator

contents.narration: What would you like to do Ranger?

parameters.target: Episode2-Jungle Car Chase Turn Response with alarm

Episode2-Jungle Car Chase Duck Response without alarm

contents.narration:
You are doing great Ranger! 
    We are currently {distanceFromPaolo} miles away from Paolo.

parameters.target: Episode2-Jungle Car Chase Random Alarm Generator

scenes.id: Episode2-Jungle Car Chase Handle End of User Turn

contents.narration:
Turning! 

    Animal alarm has been turned off.

scenes.id: Episode2-Jungle Car Chase Turn Response with alarm

contents.narration:
My sensors do not indicate that there are any animals nearby. Try 
    something else.

parameters.target: Episode2-Jungle Car Chase Prompt User for Action

scenes.id: Episode2=Jungle Car Chase Turn Response without alarm

parameters.target: Episode2-Jungle Car Chase Branch still active after Duck

scenes.id: Episode2-Jungle Car Chase Duck Response with alarm

contents.narration:
Wow nice duck! We barely missed that branch. 
    Branch alarm has been turned off.

Nice duck! But there was no branch low enough to hit us yet. 
  The branch alarm is still active.

scenes.id: Episode2-Jungle Car Chase Branch still active after Duck

contents.narration:
My sensors do not indicate that there are any low hanging branches nearby. Try 
    something else.

contents.narration:
Ouch! That one hurt! We got hit in the head with the branch! 
    The car can only take {livesLeft - 1} more hits. Watch out!

Oh no! We crashed into a bunch of animals that were running 
    through the forest! 
    The car can only take {livesLeft - 1} more hits. Watch out!

Whoa! We got hit by a rock! Those bad guys have some killer aim. 
    If we keep getting hit by those rocks I will lose control over the car. 
    The car can only take {livesLeft - 1} more hits. Watch out!

contents.narration:
Oh no. We got hit one too many times. Try and avoid getting hit 
    so much ranger. Better luck next time. Let's start from the top.

parameters.target: Episode2-Jungle Car Chase Random Alarm Generator

contents.narration:
Paolo has been located. 
     

    There he is! We found Paolo! 
    Oh no! They are really trapped behind that tree. We gotta get closer Ranger. 
     

     

    Rangers! 
     

    Paolo! We are here to help! Hang on! 
     
    We gotta get this tree trunk out of the way Ranger. 
     

    Oh no! The fire is coming fast too. Ranger. I will take care of the tree. 
 
    Try and hold back that fire with the Water Balloon Bazooka. 
     
    To activate the Bazooka just say Activate Rescue Pack! 
     
    Go Ranger Go!

Initializing rescue pack. 
    Water balloon bazooka is online and ready for you ranger.

parameters.target: Episode2-Rescuing Paolo Water Bazooka Fired Response

contents.narration:
It looks like your water balloons are pushing the fire back, Ranger. 
    Good work! 
     


     

     

    Ranger I got them out! 
     

    Rangers I am so glad to see you. I thought I was gone for sure. 
     

    That tree and that fire didn't stand a chance with the Rescue Rangers here! 
    We are so glad you and the monkeys are safe. 
     

    Thank you so much Rangers. We need to get these Monkey's back to the Treehouse. They need medical attention. 
     

    Right! Let's get to the jungle car! 
     


     
    So Paolo. While we were driving here, some bad guys were chasing us on motorcycles 
    and throwing rocks at our car. Do you have any idea who they might be? 
     

    Oh no. They must have been members of the Double Trouble Squad. I was hoping the squad 
    wasn't serious but it looks like they are getting more and more members. They have various 
    plans to take over the world and find rare animals to steal from nature to sell. 
     
    They are bad news. I am so sorry you had to run into them. Hopefully you won't ever see 
    them again.

parameters.target: Episode2-Returning back to Treehouse from Rescue

scenes.id: Episode2-Rescuing Paolo Water Bazooka Fired Response

contents.narration:
Rangers. I want to thank you from the bottom of my heart for saving me. 
     

    We are so glad we could help Paolo. 
     

    Well, the monkeys are in the Treehouse right now being cared for by my 
    medical staff. And last I heard the forest fire front is dying down.  
     

    That's great news. Looks like we aren't needed here anymore. We should probably 
    head back to headquarters. It was so great to meet you and your animals Paolo. 
     

    You as well Rangers. Please take care. Once again. Thank you. 
     

    Alright Ranger let's get back to headquarters. You can do the honors.

scenes.id: Episode2-Returning back to Treehouse from Rescue

contents.narration:
Welcome back to Rescue Rangers Headquarters. 
     

    Thanks Alice. And thank you Ranger. I couldn't have done it without you. 
    You were amazing out there today. 
     
    Here is a reward. 
     

     
    Well looks like your training is finished for today. 
     
    Come back next time so we can finish up your training.
We already found the item there. Let's try somewhere else.

Welcome back Ranger! Do you want to continue your story from where you last left
        off?

parameters.target: Help-In HQ waiting to TP to China

contents.narration: Action currently not available.
You are currently on Episode 1. You can say play the game to start playing or you can say quit to leave.

This is an adventure game where you can rescue and learn about different animals. You are currently at the main menu. You can choose to play an episode or you can look at your extras. Your extras are the treasures and badges that you have collected and earned across your journeys. You can also quit if you don't want to play.
The various Rescue Rangers adventures are split up by episode. To play an episode, just say, play episode followed by the number of the episode you want to play.
Your treasures are the hidden artifacts that you have collected along the way. Your badges are the accomplishment badges that you have earned throughout your adventures for doing amazing things.
Rescue rangers use the Field Guide Gadget's teleportation capability to teleport instantly to any place in the world. Olive wants you to try your teleportation out. Say, teleport to France.

The Field Guide Gadget includes a feature called the Animal Log Book. The Animal Log Book will automatically record interactions we have with animals on our journey. You can get info about any animal. Olive would like you to get information about Giraffes. Say, tell me about Giraffes.

The Field Guide Gadget has a nifty ability called scanning. It will scan the current environment and produce a description of all the important things within that environment. Olive would like you to try it out. Say scan.
That was the Animal Alert! There is an animal in trouble somewhere. There is an emergency call on the line. Say. Confirm. To accept the call and open the line.
A baby panda has run away! We need to get to China as soon as possible so we can try and track down the baby. Let's try using the teleport command to get to China. Say, teleport to China.

scenes.id: Help-In HQ waiting to TP to China

contents.narration: I recommend you learn more about the Panda Bear before moving on with the mission. You can do so by saying tell me about pandas.

There are various things that we can search within the enclosure. To search something, just say, search, followed by the thing you want to search. For example, to search the tree. Say, search the tree.

We should look around the panda enclosure to see if we can find any clues about where the baby panda ran off to. A scan of the enclosure should be a good starting point. Try saying <break time="0.2s" /> scan.

The scan said there is an air vent and a pile of bamboo. Let's search one of those two things. If you want to search the pile of bamboo, say, search the bamboo. If you want to search the air vent, say, search the air vent.
We are now in another part of the panda enclosure. It is a collection of Bamboo trees. Run another scan command to see what we find around here. Say, scan.

You are in a dark air vent maze. Follow Olive's prompts to go left, right, or forward in order to find your way out of the maze. The maze shape will never change, even if you get to a dead-end and have to restart. This is a trial and error puzzle.

The baby panda is inside the lion enclosure. Oh no! We need to get some information about this new area that we've stumbled upon. Maybe something around here can help us rescue the panda. Try using your scan command to find things of interest around here. Say scan.

There are various things that we can search around here. You can search the wall, the bucket, trash, or the zookeeper cart. To search something, just say, search, followed by the thing you want to search. For example, to search the cart, say search the cart.

Olive has an idea to distract the lions. Count the number of lion roars that you hear. Lion roars sound like this. <audio src='https://christianheckerlambda.s3.amazonaws.com/rescue_rangers/rescue-rangers/en-US/audio/distant_lion_roars.mp3'/> Don't confuse the sounds that other animals make for lion roars.
    
    Afterwards, tell Olive the number of lion roars that you heard. She will throw that many pieces over the wall to distract the lions. For example, if you heard 8 roars, then say 8.

That baby panda is staying up in the tree and won't come down. We know that he is hungry so let's try and hold out some food for him. Tell Olive what food you want to give to the panda. You can offer a watermelon, bamboo, a mushroom, or a slice of cheese.

We are surrounded by lions. Oh my! The only way out is up. Activate your ranger pack and use the rope to climb to the top of the wall. To start climbing, just say, climb. You need to keep climbing until you reach the top of the wall. The baby panda may get hungry or bored along the way. If you hear this sound. <audio src='https://christianheckerlambda.s3.amazonaws.com/rescue_rangers/rescue-rangers/en-US/audio/baby_panda_hungry.mp3'/>
    
    That means that the baby panda is hungry and you need to feed him bamboo. <break time="0.2s" />
    
    If you hear this sound. <audio src='https://christianheckerlambda.s3.amazonaws.com/rescue_rangers/rescue-rangers/en-US/audio/baby_panda_bored.mp3'/>
    
    That means that the baby panda is bored and you need to give him his toy. If you don't occupy the baby panda he might jump away and escape again. You can climb. Feed the baby panda. Or play with the baby panda. Good luck!

We have jumped off the lion wall and are falling fast. Say, activate parachute, or, activate ranger pack, in order to activate your parachute and slow your fall. I'd hate for us to end up as Ranger pancakes!

parameters.target: Episode1-Scan used at Arrival in China
Episode1-Player uses Scan Inside Air Vent at CP1
Episode1-Scan at Top of Lion Wall

contents.narration: You are currently in the Rescue Rangers headquarters. There is not much for me to scan around here since you are still in training mode. You can use scan anytime you want to discover things about your environment.

parameters.target: Episode1-Ranger Pack Obtained and Call Interrupts Tutorial

contents.narration: You are currently in the Rescue Rangers headquarters. What an exciting place. So many Rangers and researchers working together to make the world a better place. We are currently in a restricted training area, so nothing of interest came up in my scan.

parameters.target: Episode1-Prompt Player to Teleport to China

contents.narration: You are currently in the National Zoo of China in Beijing. We are outside of the Panda enclosure. The scenery around the Zoo is spectacular. Those pandas sure look interesting.

scenes.id: Episode1-Scan used at Arrival in China

contents.narration: We are currently in the Panda Enclosure of the National Zoo of China. There is a large tree in the center of the enclosure. On the right side there is a collection of bamboo. There is a stream of water running through the left side of the enclosure. There is a large hole at the back of the enclosure. Finally, there is a large group of pandas rolling around in a patch of grass.

You are currently inside an air vent! It sure is dark in here. Unfortunately, my scan won't be much help here. You will have to follow Ranger Olive's prompts to go left, right, or forward until we find a way out of this maze! Good luck Ranger.

Initiating scan.
    <audio src='https://christianheckerlambda.s3.amazonaws.com/rescue_rangers/rescue-rangers/en-US/audio/scan_sound.mp3'/>
    Scan complete. Here are your results.
    <break time="0.5s" />
We are currently in a bamboo forest surrounded by bamboo trees. There is a pile of chopped bamboo on the left and an open air vent on the right.

You are currently outside of the Lion Enclosure. Objects of interest around the enclosure are a trashcan and a cart with a zookeeper manual. There is also a bucket next to the cart and you can search the wall of the enclosure.

You are currently inside of a lion enclosure. This may not be the best time to be scanning. You should focus on getting the baby panda out of the lion enclosure before the distracted lions come back. I wouldn't want you to turn into cat food, Ranger.
You are currently at a large wall within the lion enclosure. You need to climb up this wall to escape the hungry lions below. Keep climbing and don't forget to feed and play with the baby panda.
There is nothing around for you to interact with. My sensors indicate we are falling at a rapid rate. Say activate ranger pack to open your parachute. Hurry Ranger!

scenes.id: Episode1-Scan at Top of Lion Wall

contents.narration: I'm sorry. I cannot perform a scan right now.
<audio src='https://christianheckerlambda.s3.amazonaws.com/rescue_rangers/rescue-rangers/en-US/audio/rescue_ranger_intro.mp3'/>

Welcome to Animal Rescue Rangers! 
    Would you like to play an episode. Or would you like to look at your collection.
Would you like to view your treasures. Or would you like to view your badges. You can also return to the main menu by saying <break time="0.2s" /> main menu.
Currently only 1 episode is available. Would you like to play that one?
I'm sorry ranger. That episode is currently not available.

<audio src='https://christianheckerlambda.s3.amazonaws.com/rescue_rangers/rescue-rangers/en-US/audio/alice_open.mp3'/>
    Initiating teleportation. Hold on tight!
    <audio src='https://christianheckerlambda.s3.amazonaws.com/rescue_rangers/rescue-rangers/en-US/audio/teleportation_sound.mp3'/>
Sorry, you can't teleport there right now!
Welcome to France.
Welcome to China.
